gameClient

Class GameThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameClient.GameThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents a thread which responsible for updating the game and the gui window (if the game is displayed in a gui window) while the game is running.
    Author:
    OriBH, ItamarZiv-On.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameThread(gameClient.GameManager gm)
      Initializes a game without option to displaying it in a gui window.
      GameThread(gameClient.GameManager gm, gameClient.MyGameGUI gui, int scenario, boolean isManualGame)
      Initializes a game with displaying it in a gui window.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      Updates the game while it is running, if gui window is open, updates the window too.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameThread

        public GameThread(gameClient.GameManager gm,
                  gameClient.MyGameGUI gui,
                  int scenario,
                  boolean isManualGame)
        Initializes a game with displaying it in a gui window.
        Parameters:
        gm - - the game object.
        gui - - the gui object.
        isManualGame - - Indication whether the game is manual or automatic.

      • GameThread

        public GameThread(gameClient.GameManager gm)
        Initializes a game without option to displaying it in a gui window.
        Parameters:
        gm - - the game object.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Updates the game while it is running, if gui window is open, updates the window too. When the game ends, prints the final result and enables to save the game in KML format.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
